isis.stitle: GENERAL INSTRUMENT ELECTRONIC PROGRAMMABLE SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER - TEST 4 - SENSOR OUTPUT VOLTAGE TEST (AT INSTRUMENT PANEL)

svcproc.title: TEST 4 - SENSOR OUTPUT VOLTAGE TEST (AT INSTRUMENT PANEL)

svcprocinfo.para: The purpose of this test is to verify the signal generated by the sensor, and that the signal is properly transmitted through vehicle harness to the speedometer/tachometer unit.

svcsubproc.title: Speedometer Sensor Voltage Check

item.para: Turn key switch to OFF position.
This test requires an AC voltmeter (Alternating Current).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 14 for this test.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. AC VOLTMETER SET AT 0-10 VOLT SCALE A. VEHICLE HARNESS SPEEDOMETER CONNECTOR B. CIRCUIT 47A OR 47B OR 47C C. CIRCUIT 47A OR 11BC OR 47E

step1.para: Set the AC voltmeter to the 0-10 volt scale. Connect the meter leads to instrument panel harness speedometer connector at terminals 47A and 11BC (96/9700) or 47A and 47B (93/9400) or 47C and 47E (3406B w/PEEC).
Raise the rear wheels of the vehicle and place floor stands under the rear axles. Start engine, place vehicle in high gear and run at IDLE speed. Voltage reading should be 2.0 volts AC minimum.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or property damage pay strict attention to the following: Should it be necessary to operate the rear wheels (with engine power) with the vehicle stationary and the rear wheels raised from the ground, first disengage the front axle; otherwise the driving front axle will pull the vehicle off its support. Parking brakes should be applied when the transmission and the transfer case have been left in the neutral position with the engine running or not running.
Do not use a jack when working under a vehicle. It may give way, causing the vehicle to fall and injure you. Always use floor stands to support the vehicle.

step1.para: If there is NO voltage indicated go to TEST 5. If voltage is indicated but LOW (less than 2.0 volts) go to TEST 6.

svcsubproc.title: Tachometer Sensor Voltage Check

item.para: Turn key switch to OFF position.
This test requires an AC voltmeter (Alternating Current).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 15 for this test.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. AC VOLTMETER SET AT 0-10 VOLT SCALE A. VEHICLE HARNESS TACHOMETER CONNECTOR B. CIRCUIT L48B OR 48B C. CIRCUIT C48A OR 48A

step1.para: Set the AC voltmeter to the 0-10 volt scale. Connect the meter leads to instrument panel harness tachometer connector at terminals C48A and L48B (96/9700) or 48A and 48B (93/9400).

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or property damage pay strict attention to the following: Should it be necessary to operate the rear wheels (with engine power) with the vehicle stationary and the rear wheels raised from the ground, first disengage the front axle; otherwise the driving front axle will pull the vehicle off its support. Parking brakes should be applied when the transmission and the transfer case have been left in the neutral position with the engine running or not running.
Do not use a jack when working under a vehicle. It may give way, causing the vehicle to fall and injure you. Always use floor stands to support the vehicle.

step1.para: Place wheel chocks under wheels, set park brake and place transmission in neutral. Start engine and run at IDLE speed. Voltage reading should be 2.0 volts AC minimum.

If there is NO voltage indicated go to TEST 5. If voltage is indicated but LOW (less than 2.0 volts) go to TEST 6. If TEST 4 was successful (after successful tests in TEST 2, TEST 7 and TEST 3) install speedometer/tachometer unit in vehicle and rerun TEST 1.
